snippet: A new state-by-state study of the impact of economic and social environments on mortality found that where a woman live matters as much as who she is....
abstract: Study published in journal SSM Population Health finds many common demographic traits in life expectancy of American women may not be as important as their home state's economic and social environment; unexpected aspect of study's findings is that same factors do not have as significant an impact on longevity of men.
lead_paragraph: A new state-by-state study of the impact of economic and social environments on mortality found that where a woman live matters as much as who she is.

headline.main: New Clues in the Mystery of Women’s Lagging Life Expectancy
headline.print_headline: New Clues in the Mystery of Lagging Life Expectancy for American Women
